definition: to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: Talent never goes unrecognized, through constant endeavour will it be seen.
sentences.chinese: 世上沒有懷才不遇，只看你是否百分百爭取。

sentences.english: After all, "Shaolin Soccer" is a story for the talented but unnoted .
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，少林足球是一個關於懷才不遇的故事。

sentences.english: First with wit is divided into two unsuccessful preeminence.
sentences.chinese: 先把才子分爲出人頭地與懷才不遇兩種。

sentences.english: Or you feel underappreciated and over-worked.
sentences.chinese: 或許你覺得自己懷才不遇又超額工作。

definition: tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
separated in life and death/to part for ever
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
to become demoralized/to lose one's sense of purpose
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
